name: v3.1.8
body: * thanks to @beckerdennis to make Poiji run on Java 17 [#239]

name: v3.1.7
body: * fix code smells

name: v3.1.6
body: * Apache poi version upgrade

name: v3.1.5
body:
* use Apache Poi 5.1.0
* fix #223 thanks to @beckerdennis

name: v3.1.4
body:
- enable github action flows
- fix #216 thanks to @beckerdennis

name: v3.1.3
body: * load default style formats

name: v3.1.2
body: * enable to support optional mandatory columns

name: v3.1.1
body: * #138 Getting raw data

name: v3.1.0
body: * Support Apache Poi 5.0.0

name: v3.0.3
body: * [#185] Default system locale gives different behavior
* [#181] Support multiple level headers

name: v3.0.1
body:
* [#168] Are we able to create POJO mapping for List<String> columns or String[].Does it support?
* [#169] Option to get cell value instead of formula
* [#176] fix warnings
* [#175] trimming spaces option for headers 
* [#172] Support to read from single sheet instead of a complete excel file 
* Enable to use custom header formatting option

* [#161] Unable to correctly convert negative numbers with parentheses
* [#163] PoijiHandler.cell() is not ignoring earlier header lines when using PoijiOptions .headerStart(1)
* [#164] Excel file without headers, skipping first line

name: v2.9.0
body: * [#158] Add LibreOffice calc compatibility for boolean values, thanks to @Brutus5000
* [#151] Add reading fields from custom properties (metadata) thanks to @breucode

name: v2.7.0
body:
* [#152] Add check that all headers specified by @ExcelCellName are present.
* [#150] Dates with an incomplete format in .xlsx file are not being parsed.
[#124] Case Insensitive column names option
* #117 : Use native class references for type comparison

* [#90] Apache Poi version upgrade
* [#89] New instance for non-puplic models
* [#85] Credit goes to @brunslo : Add ability to track the location of cells that raise casting exceptions

New Feature:

#77  (credit goes to @4sujittiwari)

name: v1.19.2
body: * Bug fix
With 1.19.1, we have the ability to produce a custom casting configuration by implementing the `Casting` interface, credits go to @NiklasMehner !

This version comes with two important features thanks to @kpolli !

* The `headerStart` method allows us to specify the position (index) of Header in a given excel file. If you use the `skip` functionality, It will ignore the rows starting after the header index. 
* A new annotation `ExcelCellRange ` is introduced. It enables to be used in fields with inner objects so as know the range of cells is for the inner objects.

As of 1.18.1, Poiji uses Apache Poi 4.0.0

You can now use `BigDecimal` type with the poiji annotations,  i.e.  `ExcelCell` and `ExcelCellName ` (#62 )

Two New Features (#57) :

* Set the lenient option to true or false (defaults) for the `java.util.Date` object
* Control the date format using a regex pattern.

You can look at the related PR #58. Credits go to @Developer-Matt

New Feature: 

#55 (credit goes to @Developer-Matt )

Fixed Issues:

* #52 
* #51 
* #47
